name: Ten Days In April Quiz | Famous Dates | 10 Questions

questions.text: This great navigator left the Earth on April 27th, 1521. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Ferdinand Magellan.

	Magellan was killed in the Philippines. Despite never completing his voyage, he was credited with being the first man to circumnavigate the globe because, on an earlier trip EASTWARD, he had reached the Moluccas Islands. The place where he was killed, was a point further WESTWARD than the point to which he had travelled before. Boy that was a mouthful.

questions.text: Church records show that this Englishman was baptised on 26th April 1564 ... April 23rd is widely accepted as his birth date. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
William Shakespeare.

	He died on 23rd April 1616, at his home in Stratford-on-Avon.

questions.text: A dreadful list of U.S. Presidential assassinations began on 14th April 1865, with the shooting of this great man. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Abraham Lincoln.

	Lincoln was shot at Ford's Theater, Washington DC, by John Wilkes Booth.

questions.text: Who was the comedic giant born on 16th April 1889 in Walworth, London, England?
questions.explanation:
Charlie Chaplin.

	Sir Charles Chaplin became one of Hollywood's impresarios. He died on Christmas Day 1977, at his home in Switzerland.

questions.text: This dictator was born on 20th April 1889. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Hitler.

	Few things can be said about this man, that have not been said already. He remains one of the most hated figures in history. Strangely, he is also revered by some.

questions.text: One of the most talked about incidents of the 20th century, took place on 14th  April 1912. What was it?
questions.correct: Titanic struck an iceberg and sank early the next day
questions.explanation:
Titanic struck an iceberg and sank early the next day.

	The 'unsinkable' Titanic struck an iceberg at 11.40 pm on its maiden voyage and sank 2 hours later, killing over 1,500 people. It remains one of the worst maritime disasters of all time.

questions.text: This genius died on 18th April 1955, in Princeton, New Jersey. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Albert Einstein.

	Einstein won the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1921, for his explanation of the Photoelectric Effect.

questions.text: One of the most senseless murders of the 20th century took place on 4th April 1968. Who was killed?
questions.explanation:
Martin Luther King Jr.

	Dr King was one of the most eloquent speakers of all time. He led the civil rights movement from the mid fifties until his assassination.

questions.text: Which Spanish giant died in Mougins, France, on 8th April 1973?
questions.explanation:
Pablo Picasso.

	Picasso is considered the greatest artist of the twentieth century. He lived in France from 1901 until his death.

questions.text: One of the worst acts of U.S. domestic terrorism took place on 19th April 1995. What was it?
options: Bombing of the car park at the World Trade Center, N.Y.
Explosion of Pan Am flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland
Bombing of the U.S. embassies in Kenya and Tanzania
questions.explanation:
Oklahoma City bombing.

	The Murrah Federal Building was torn apart by the huge explosion causing heavy loss of life. Timothy McVeigh has since been executed for his act of terrorism.
